page.title: 18FARMING NEAR TOW LAW 2/2
page.content:
{Because of the poor soil and harsh {climate much of the farmland around {Tow Law is used for cattle and sheep.
The most common breeds of sheep reared around here are {Swaledales}and{Mules. The hardy Swaledale is more often found on the hills and Tow Law fell. The Mule is a half-breed sheep with the ability to produce and rear many lambs. It is usually seen on farmland. {The traditional Mule is a Bluefaced {Leicester ram and a Swaledale ewe.
The cattle are usually of mixed stock. {Hereford, Friesan, Charolais and {Marchigiana}are some of the breeds to be seen.
{Many of the cattle and sheep are sold {at the local mart in Tow Law.
